ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: My speaking and writing abilities greatly improved. I feel much more comfortable using advanced grammatical structures.

I think this course helped me to improve many aspects of grammar that I had previously thought were very difficult. For example, I think I improved my use of por vs para and preterite vs imperfect. I am also much more comfortable using the subjunctive in conversation. In addition, I feel much more confident in my conjugation abilities for all the tenses.
I significantly improved my grammar skills.

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments: A lot of the homework felt like busy work. We had to read a whole novel, but we only needed it for one short answer question on an examen. Prof. Santos is a great teacher and cares a lot for her students.

A strength is the emphasis on grammar. I really think some difficult grammar topics were covered well and really helped me improve my sentence structure when writing and speaking. A weakness is the lack of vocabulary. Even though I was really improving my grammar, it was hard to show it without a translation helper because I never truly processed any new vocabulary.

Too many assessments but it did a good job in reinforcing grammar skills. I think more opportunities to practice my speaking skills would have been helpful. Also, the readings were really long and difficult, making them hard to get through and I feel like I got little out of them except for the pressure to understand them and memorize things.

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: To an extent. It was fine to fulfill language credit.
